attributes.action: Parliament to ask that the Honour given to Glynn Williams be rescinded.
attributes.background: In the recent Honours List, Mr Williams was awarded the Order of the Bath. Mr Williams contributed to, if not responsible for, the Windrush scandal and the tardy correction of it. It is entirely wrong for civil servants to be rewarded for poor if not disgraceful performance.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions asking for people's honours to be taken away. You can find out more about how honours are taken away here: 

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/having-honours-taken-away-forfeiture
